Panel Name

fwElmbNodeOperation.pnl
Introduction
 This panel is used for the operation of a selected ELMB that has been created in the current system.
Instructions There are two main 'sections' to this panel (Figure 1):

Table Showing Information

There are a number of columns shown in this table. Below is a brief description of what information is shown in each column.

Channel Name - The name given to the channel at creation time is dispayed

Type - The type of channel is displayed here, whether analog or digital, input or output. If the channel is an analog input, the sensor type is also shown.

Value - The value of the channel

Time Stamp - The time stamp of the last value update

ELMB management and states

Various operations are available from this section which apply to the ELMB. Also some more information regarding the operational state of the ELMB is displayed.

Start - Clicking this button sends an NMT (Network ManagemenT) command to the ELMB that starts (or sets operational) the ELMB.

Stop - Clicking this button sends an NMT Stop command to the ELMB.

Reset - Clicking this button sends an NMT Reset command to the ELMB. This will cause the ELMB to re-boot, and therefore a bootup message should be received from the node.

ELMB state - This gives a text value indicating the operational state of the ELMB.

Last bootup time - This shows the time stamp of the last received bootup message

Last Emergency Message - This gives the value of the last emergency message with it's time stamp

Restrictions

 

Figure 1: Elmb Node Operation panel

Dollar Parameters
Name Description  
$sDpName The name of the datapoint for the ELMB to be operated. Required
